result.execSummary:
The defendant Margo E Prom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both counts are Concurrent with one another, with same conditions also concurrent
.

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
letter dated 2/15 from Atty Hammer    re: Def rejection of probation
Email from Atty Hammer dated 2/16   re: if request is granted, def will be placed on bond & we will appear in Br 4 for sentencing on the 26th

Def in court w/Atty Russell Edward Hammer.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HAMMER: she was decompensating w/ mental health problems. I tried to call your office to set up a hearing sooner. She has waited for the admin process to happen and hasn't seen anyone from DOC.  She had sat 3 wks in custody w/o release. CRT: she has a right to reject probation I want to know how she did on probation over the past yr. HAMMER: she has  2 open files and we anticipate probation. for her level of offense and her trmt needs, they didn't have anything for her. Skemp and I agreed upon that she has done enough confinement time. Heidi would have asked for  90-120 days CJ at a SEHR. HYNEK: a period of EM is approp. She would like drug testing as there are AODA issues. HAMMER: all of these lead back to sub abuse. DEF: I will take accountability for my actions. I haven't had a drink since 2013. 
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
SENTENCE: as to each count def to serve   105 days concurrent   w/ credit for 33 days - to be served on EM thru JSS. 
ejss

State by Skemp /  Def in custody w/ Atty Russ Hammer
Hammer:  Def wishes to reject probation.  We are asking she be released to JSS.  There is SEH w/ SLH on 2-26-16....
Skemp:  we are not objecting to def rejecting probation
CRT:  Def will be allowed to reject her probation.  In meantime, she can be released on a $200 Sig bond w/ conditions:  Comply w/ JSS w/ testing for alcohol & drugs

State by Skemp / def w/ Atty Eric Sanford
Amended Info filed
Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
Cts 1 & 2 - Def pleads GUILTY
CRT:  Plea is F&V made - sufficient factual basis exists to support plea - Def found guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 12 mos, on each count concurrent w/ conditions also concurrent:  Complete 50 hrs Comm Serv (Concurrent, 1-time only);  Follow the mental health program recommended by Dr. Metzler;  Complete any other assessments PO deems necessary;  Pay CC & DOC fees; 
 Apply bond to financial obligation - balance of bond to be refunded to Surety

11:19 am Def in court w/Atty Eric S. Sanford.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea discussions.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is F & V made.  Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.
PTC:  2/27 at 3:30 pm       STC:  3/19 at 10 am   SLH
Sanford asks for a reduction in cash.  Skemp no obj.
COURT:  Keep $1,000 cash w/ the same conditions.  Refund $1,500 cash
